block.p: Tracy Ann Williams, a daughter of Ethel and Kenneth Williams of Naples, Fla., is to be married today to Brendan Christopher Kennedy, the son of Dana Kennedy and William Kennedy, the novelist, of Averill Park, N.Y. The Rev. Derik J. Roy will perform the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Ballston Spa, N.Y.

Mrs. Kennedy, 30, is a sales associate at Morgan Stanley Dean Witter, the stock brokerage house in New York. She graduated from St. Lawrence University. Her father retired as the senior partner for nonprofit and higher-education clients at Coopers Lybrand, the accounting firm, in Syracuse.

Tracy Ann Williams, a daughter of Ethel and Kenneth Williams of Naples, Fla., is to be married today to Brendan Christopher Kennedy, the son of Dana Kennedy and William Kennedy, the novelist, of Averill Park, N.Y. The Rev. Derik J. Roy will perform the ceremony at Christ Episcopal Church in Ballston Spa, N.Y.

Mrs. Kennedy, 30, is a sales associate at Morgan Stanley Dean Witter, the stock brokerage house in New York. She graduated from St. Lawrence University. Her father retired as the senior partner for nonprofit and higher-education clients at Coopers Lybrand, the accounting firm, in Syracuse.

Mr. Kennedy, 30, is the head of Web site development at bigstar.com, an online entertainment retailer in New York. He is also the author with his father of two children's books, ''Charlie Malarkey and the Singing Moose'' (Viking, 1994) and ''Charlie Malarkey and the Belly Button Machine'' (Atlantic Monthly Press, 1986.) He graduated from Trinity College in Hartford. His father, who won a Pulitzer Prize in 1984 for ''Ironweed,'' is the director of the New York State Writers Institute at the State University at Albany. His mother was a professional dancer under the name Dana Sosa and founded the Dana Kennedy School of Dance, which was in West Sand Lake, N.Y.
